headline: Kari Lake Besting Other Republican Challengers in Race Against Democrat Katie Hobbs
author: George Khalaf
sentences:
With her commanding position in recent primary surveys and her strong performance against Democrat Katie Hobbs, Kari Lake is the Republican frontrunner in the Arizona Gubernatorial race.”
Methodology
This poll of 1,000 likely general election voters was conducted through a live survey that collected 50.7% of the results from landlines and 49.3% from cell phones.
Pollster George Khalaf had this to say about the latest results, “With all statewide offices up for grabs this year, Arizona once again finds itself in the center of the limelight.
We offer precise data solutions, informed by political and policy intelligence, so our clients can chart the right course through the corporate or political landscape ahead.
With a little more than eight months until the General Election, the share of voters that are “Undecided” on the race is close to 20% across the board.
While there has been chatter among insiders surrounding general election viability for Kari Lake, it is clear voters do not share those same concerns.
With a little more than eight months until the 2022 General Election, Kari Lake is currently besting her fellow Republican challengers.

ABOUT DATA ORBITAL:
Data Orbital is a full-service data solutions and survey research firm with local, state, and national experience.
Data Orbital is pleased to announce the results of its latest statewide, live-caller survey of likely general election voters.
Respondents were weighted on a number of different demographic figures based on prior general election voter turnout figures.
With little data publicly available, the survey focused on the upcoming, hotly contested race for Governor in Arizona.
All non-released questions would not reasonably be expected to influence responses to all released questions.
The survey tested all four Republican candidates against likely Democrat nominee Katie Hobbs.
It had a margin of error at plus or minus 3.1% with a 95% confidence interval.
The questions released are verbatim from the survey provided to respondents.
The survey was conducted from February 11th to February 13th.
The poll was conducted from February 11 – February 13, 2022.
Crosstabs for this survey are available upon request.
